channel.title: Community on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in Community on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: What's New in February 2025
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: From remote-first to hybrid: We’ve transitioned to a hybrid model, coordinated schedules, and rolled out perks like lunch support, transport coverage, and an Office Leaderboard to keep engagement high.

item.title: Weekly Digest #15: New year Gathering: Sharing Tết, starting strong
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We kicked off our gathering after Tết, bringing the community back together in true Dwarves style - dropping some SOL and ICY tokens into everyone’s wallets, bringing the community back together in true Dwarves style.

item.title: What's New in November 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Building the team’s second brain: Progress in platform & data engineering, smarter decision-making, and new directions ahead. Sharpening OGIF weekly sharing: Updates to align with team priorities and industry trends for deeper learning.

item.title: What's New in October 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We’re Hiring: On the lookout for Full-stack Engineers, Biz Devs, and Marketing minds to join the team. Labs OGIF Office Hour - Building Core Knowledge: Weekly sessions diving deep into AI, Blockchain, Architecture, and Finance fundamentals.

item.title: Open Source
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: So much of the software we rely on every day is built on the backs of open-source projects. We believe wholeheartedly that embracing open source will make our products the best they can be.

item.title: What's New in September 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: 🧙・ai-club: We launched the AI-Club, your go-to hub for diving into AI and LLMs, where curiosity sparks real projects and dynamic discussions.

item.title: What's New in August 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Reporting tech signal: How AI tools like Cursor and Claude 3.5 Sonnet are changing programming, with insights on generative apps, prompt caching, and structured outputs.

item.title: Record and reward sharing at Dwarves
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Record & reward sharing at Dwarves If you’re part of the Dwarves community, you’ll notice our culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing.

item.title: What's New in July 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Reporting Tech Signals: Significant AI advancements, cybersecurity focus, and shifting software development trends. memo.d.foundation: You can now access new commands to view the memo list and automate weekly reports.

item.title: State of Dwarves: 2024 Semi-annual Review
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In the past six months, we’ve made some pretty impressive strides in testing new standards and adding more automation, activities, and rewards to our Discord server to foster a supportive community among tech lovers.

item.title: What's New in June 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: memo.d.foundation: more entries focusing on software design, LLM and blockchain, a key focus of our continuous learning journey. Increased ICY Rewards: the increasing amount of fleeting notes boosted our learning reward system.

item.title: Weekly Digest #11: Come grow with us
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Things are always cooking on our Discord. So grab a virtual seat at our table, pour yourself a cup of something tasty, and enjoy the digest.

item.title: Weekly Digest #10: From lean to learner
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Double digits, I can’t believe we’ve reached our 10th digest! It’s been quite a journey putting together each edition and a blast creating these for you.

item.title: What's New in May 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Dwarves offline meet-up: Gathering over 50 members for networking, OGIF talks, and casual team dinner. ICY rewards: We’ve boosted the monthly ICY reward pool to a whopping $1,500.

item.title: Dwarves’ 2nd community offline meet-up
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: At the end of May, we had the pleasure of hosting our second community meet-up. With over 50 folks, including notable community members @jack, @congiomat, and @tannhatcms, it was a meaningful gathering.

item.title: Weekly Digest #9: A little more speed for summer
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: How quickly the first half of the year speeds up before it slows down. It’s really the second half of 2024 already.

item.title: Echelon X Singapore 2024: Where Innovations Meet Inspiration
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This year’s Echelon X in Singapore was a bustling hub of innovation, bringing together around 10,000 participants, including 154 speakers, 50 TOP100 startups, investors, corporates, and government agencies from over 35 countries.

item.title: Weekly Digest #8: Then came the last days of May
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Here’s to hoping for a brighter and better month on this last day of May. We’re in the heat of a community offline meet-up today, gathering to discuss the month’s progress.

item.title: Weekly Digest #7: A journey through time
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The sun peeks over the horizon, Saturday vibes and good news – the perfect combo. We’re about to spice up your weekend with a recap of all the awesome things we whipped up this week.

item.title: Weekly Digest #6: Come for the conversation, stay for the culture
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Hi, it’s @innno_ again. Summer is almost here. But don’t worry, this update is all about making your day more comfortable.

item.title: What's New in April 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Reporting tech signals: major updates in Meta’s Llama 3, the growth of RAG systems, the move to edge computing, and the influence of Bun 1.

item.title: Weekly Digest #5: Endure the hardship, delay the gratification
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Greetings from Saigon, I’m here again, bringing you a lot of updates. There are big and small things brewing at Dwarves network.

item.title: Weekly Digest #4: Finding your authentic tribe
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Welcome back to the #4 weekly digest after a long holiday. Those Discord channels are still buzzing with active messages. Without further ado, let’s see what I’ve got to share.

item.title: Weekly Digest #3: We all start somewhere
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Huge news is on the horizon. You absolutely will not guess what we’re about to share. We remember last week like it was yesterday, but what truly counts is that you’re here with us.

item.title: Weekly Digest #2: Walk around learn around
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: There are so many amazingly fun and wonderfully weird things happening on Discord, both last week and of course, today. So let’s dive in with a freshly-brewed “cà phê sữa,” of course.

item.title: Weekly Digest #1: What do you stand for?
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Lock in Your Workspace. Show the World. Our Discord crew is buzzing with energy after our last Friday community call, with folks sharing snapshots of their workspaces.

item.title: Design less, present more with Deckset
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Do you ever feel overwhelmed by the myriad of design tools and options in PowerPoint, or the countless books and tutorials dedicated to beautifying a single sentence on a 100-inch screen?

item.title: Level Up Your Markdown Memos: Avoiding Common Pitfalls
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Markdown uses symbols and stuff to make your text look fancy. It’s like learning a new skill, game, or design program - there will be bumps in the road before you’re a pro.

item.title: What's New in March 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Reporting tech signals: everything new on artificial intelligence, API techniques, toolings, programming languages, and the intersection of design and engineering.

item.title: How To Take Better Screenshots On Mac
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: I grab screenshots pretty often. Although macOS’s native screenshot tool is decent for most cases, it’s still a very basic one.

item.title: Starting your journey at Dwarves Discord
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Welcome to Dwarves Network, We’ve grown a lot since launching our Discord server since the first day we made this network grow based on developers-centric.

item.title: What's New in January 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Before you dive in Dwarves is operated as a 50% company, 50% community. Everything we learn along the way of work, we transform into knowledge and distribute back to our tech community.

item.title: Dwarves Community
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Dwarves Community is melting pot for software engineers, thinkers, learners and techies who are to explore, learn and master the latest advancements in technology.

item.title: Digest
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This page holds a collection of both our internal and external events, including the things we do with the Labs team, Consulting team, Operations, team, and the community.

item.title: $icy in 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Follow up on our recent post df protocol, $icy and $dfg. Since 2020, $icy has been a part of our workflow.

item.title: What's New in October 2023
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Before you dive in Dwarves is operated as a 50% company, 50% community. Everything we learn along the way of work, we transform into knowledge and distribute back to our tech community.

item.title: Community Bounty
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: As you may know, Dwarves Discord network is where we connect with our friends, alumni, and like-minded people. Bounties are rewards (in ICY - Dwarves’ token) given out to community members for work that encourages community developers to get more involved in the development outside of their core skills.

item.title: Working On A Project Interview Assessment At Dwarves
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: I had my fair share of interviews. Most of them are “traditional” QnA sessions, and unpaid take-home projects, and coding assessments.

item.title: Discord Roles
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: To organize our discord and make it fun to interact between community members, we setup those roles for specific purposes. They are ladder-based and function-based roles.
